book.of.utilities 1.1.0
  • Reference

    Cycle Counter

    count.cycles.Rd

    count.cycles detects and maps conditional occurrence frequency

    Usage

    count.cycles(cond, offset = 1, reset)

    Arguments

    cond

    (logical[]) A logical vector

    offset

    (integer|1) An integer defining the series origin

    reset

    (logical[]) A logical vector of the same length as cond such that when TRUE, the cycle counter resets to the offset

    Value

    A one-based (default), conditionally-incremented series

    See also

    Other Counters: factor.int()

    Examples

    data.table::data.table(cond_vec = (runif(1000) >= 0.7) %>% sample(100), rand_col = sample(letters, 100, TRUE), key = "rand_col")[, .(cond_vec, rand_col, cyc = count.cycles(cond_vec, reset = !duplicated(rand_col)))]
#>      cond_vec rand_col cyc
#>   1:    FALSE        a   1
#>   2:    FALSE        a   1
#>   3:    FALSE        a   1
#>   4:    FALSE        a   1
#>   5:     TRUE        a   2
#>   6:    FALSE        b   1
#>   7:    FALSE        b   1
#>   8:     TRUE        c   1
#>   9:    FALSE        c   1
#>  10:    FALSE        c   1
#>  11:    FALSE        c   1
#>  12:     TRUE        c   2
#>  13:    FALSE        c   2
